In today’s #TX31Spotlight, Round Rock High School’s Dragon print shop offers its students the ability to work and learn in a functioning and profitable wide-format printing and design facility. In just one year, RRHS has developed a student-run design program that partners with local businesses to provide internships, as well as real world business experience. Students in the program meet with clients, take orders, and oversee the entire design process and post-production of products ranging from t-shirts to vinyl banners. The profits earned from this business are then returned to the program in order to offer even more students the opportunity to enter their career field with relevant experience.  #CTEMonth

This is common-sense, life saving legislation, and I'm proud to see such great bipartisan support.

The Veterans Transplant Coverage Act was inspired by the Nelson family, #TX31 constituents from Leander, Texas. Today the Nelson family and I joined together to bring their story to Congress.   When Charles Nelson, a 100% disabled veteran, needed a kidney transplant, his son was a match - but the VA system denied him coverage. Instead the Nelson’s were forced to solicit donations to pay for the surgery and save Charles’ life. After hearing that the Nelson’s had to fundraise and drain their savings because of the VA’s policy, I knew that I had to bring this fight to Washington.   Unfortunately, the Nelson’s story is one of far too many. This bill will ensure no other American hero is denied transplant coverage again.

Our mission ➡️ ensure no veteran is denied transplant coverage ever again.  This bill was inspired by the Nelson family, our #TX31 neighbors from Leander, who joined me in DC this week as I testified before the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs. Together, we are fighting to get our veterans the treatment they deserve.   Too many veterans are denied access to life-saving transplant procedures because their donor is not also a veteran. We're sharing the Nelsons' story and making important changes so no veteran will be denied a transplant again.  Mr. Nelson deserved better - our veterans deserve better. My bill will allow veterans to receive live donations from non-veterans, and allow them to have the procedure done at their own local hospital. This is common-sense, life-saving legislation, and I'm proud to see such great bipartisan support.
